00061 static TGlobalData *g_event=NULL;
00062 static TFile *gInFile=NULL;

00064 // Temporary botch to let ExportPulse module know what the current entry
00065 // number is.  I'm assuming Phill's Event Navigator will provide this
00066 // functionality, so I'll remove this at that point.
00067 Long64_t* gEntryNumber;
00068 Long64_t* gTotalEntries;

00083 int main(int argc, char **argv){
00084 //load_config_file("MODULES.txt");
00085 
00086   // Parse the command line
00087   ARGUMENTS arguments;
00088   int ret = analyze_command_line (argc, argv,arguments);
00089   if(ret!=0) return ret;
00090   // Give the command line arguments to the navigator
00091   SetupNavigator::Instance()->SetCommandLineArgs(arguments);
00092 
00093   // Read in the configurations file
00094   ret= modules::navigator::Instance()->LoadConfigFile(arguments.mod_file.c_str());
00095   if(ret!=0) {
00096      std::cout<<"Error: Problem loading MODULES file"<<std::endl;
00097      return ret;
00098   }
00099 
00100   // Open the input tree file
00101   gInFile = new TFile(arguments.infile.c_str());
00102   if(!gInFile->IsOpen()) {
00103     std::cout << "Failed to open input file '"
00104               << arguments.infile <<"'.  Exiting." << std::endl;
00105     delete gInFile;
00106     return 1;
00107   }
00108   
00109   // Make an initial call to singleton objects that are very likely to be called at some point.
00110   ret = PrepareSingletonObjects(arguments);
00111   if(ret!=0) {
00112      std::cout<<"Error: Problem creating a singleton object..."<<std::endl;
00113      return ret;
00114   }
00115 
00116   // Now that we've loaded the TSetupData for this run check if there are any
00117   // suggested replacements for the wiremap data
00118   //CheckSetupData(s_data, arguments.correction_file);
00119 
00120   //Event Tree
00121   TTree* eventTree = GetTree(gInFile,"EventTree");
00122   if(!eventTree) return 1;
00123   eventTree->SetBranchAddress("Event",&g_event);
00124 
00125   // Let's open the output file for analysis data, histograms and so on.
00126   TFile *fileOut = new TFile(arguments.outfile.c_str(), "RECREATE");
00127   if(!fileOut->IsOpen()){
00128     std::cout << "Could not open ROOT output file " 
00129               << arguments.outfile << std::endl;
00130     return 1;
00131   }
00132   modules::navigator::Instance()->SetOutFile(fileOut);
00133 
00134   // Now let's setup all the analysis modules we want
00135   // NOTE: This has to be done after the output file was opened else the
00136   // modules wont have a directory to store things to.
00137   ret= modules::navigator::Instance()->MakeModules();
00138   if(ret!=0) {
00139      printf("Problem creating analysis modules.\n");
00140      return ret;
00141   }
00142   
00143   // Setup the analysed pulse map to store / read in the pulses
00144   ret = PrepareAnalysedPulseMap(fileOut);
00145   if(ret!=0) {
00146      printf("Problem preparing analysed pulse map.");
00147      return ret;
00148   }
00149 
00150   // Finally let's do the main loop
00151   fileOut->cd();
00152   Main_event_loop(eventTree,arguments);
00153 
00154   // and finish up
00155   fileOut->cd();
00156   gAnalysedPulseTree->Write();
00157   fileOut->Write();
00158   fileOut->Close();
00159   gInFile->Close();
00160 
00161   return 0;
00162 }
00163 
00164 Int_t Main_event_loop(TTree* dataTree,ARGUMENTS& arguments){
00165 /*************************************************************************\
00166 | Loop over tree entries and call histogramming modules.                  |
00167 \*************************************************************************/
00168   Long64_t nentries = dataTree->GetEntriesFast();
00169   printf("There are %d entries\n",(int)nentries);
00170   std::cout<<"Processing file, which may take a while. "
00171      "Have patience young padawan.."<<std::endl;
00172 
00173   //set up the input data
00174   if (g_event){
00175     g_event->Clear("C");
00176     dataTree->SetBranchAddress("Event",&g_event);
00177   }
00178 
00179   // How many entries should we loop over?
00180   Long64_t start = 0;
00181   Long64_t stop = nentries;
00182   if(arguments.stop>0){
00183     if(arguments.start>0)
00184       start = (Long64_t)(arguments.start-1);
00185     if((Long64_t)arguments.stop < nentries)
00186       stop = (Long64_t)arguments.stop;
00187   }
00188   else if((Long64_t)arguments.start < nentries && arguments.start > 0){
00189     stop = (Long64_t)arguments.start;
00190   }
00191   gTotalEntries=&stop;
00192   // wind the file on to the first event
00193   dataTree->GetEntry(start);
00194 
00195   // Get the first and last module to run with
00196   modules::iterator first_module = modules::navigator::Instance()->Begin();
00197   modules::iterator last_module = modules::navigator::Instance()->End();
00198   modules::iterator it_mod;
00199 
00200   int q = 0;
00201   for (it_mod=first_module; it_mod != last_module; it_mod++) {
00202     q |= it_mod->second->BeforeFirstEntry(g_event, TSetupData::Instance());
00203   }
00204   if(q) {
00205     printf("Error while preprocessing first entry (%d)\n",(Int_t)start);
00206     return q;
00207   }
00208 
00209   q = 0;
00210   //process entries
00211   Long64_t jentry;
00212   gEntryNumber=&jentry;
00213   for ( jentry=start; jentry<stop;jentry++) {
00214     if(g_event){
00215       g_event->Clear("C");
00216       //ClearGlobalData(g_event);
00217       dataTree->SetBranchAddress("Event",&g_event);
00218     }
00219     
00220     if (jentry%100 == 0) {
00221       printf("Completed %lld events out of %lld\n", jentry, stop);
00222     }
00223     // Let's get the next event
00224     dataTree->GetEntry(jentry);
00225 
00226     for (it_mod=first_module; it_mod != last_module; it_mod++) {
00227       q |= it_mod->second->ProcessGenericEntry(g_event,TSetupData::Instance());
00228       //if(q) break;
00229     }
00230     if(q){
00231       printf("q was non-zero when jentry was %lld\n",jentry);
00232       break;
00233     }
00234 
00235     gAnalysedPulseMapWrapper->SetMap(gAnalysedPulseMap);
00236     //gAnalysedPulseMapWrapper->ShowInfo();
00237     gAnalysedPulseTree->Fill();
00238   }
00239 
00240   //post-process on last entry
00241   q = 0;
00242   for (it_mod=first_module; it_mod != last_module; it_mod++) {
00243     q |= it_mod->second->AfterLastEntry(g_event,TSetupData::Instance());
00244   }
00245   if (q) {
00246      printf("Error during post-processing last entry (%lld)\n",(stop-1));
00247       return q;
00248   }
00249   
00250   printf("Finished processing data normally\n");
00251   return 0;
00252 }
00253 
00254 void ClearGlobalData(TGlobalData* data)
00255 {
00256   // We could put this into TGlobalData::Clear(), but we need
00257   // to be sure that's okay at the alcapana level. That is, if
00258   // Clear() deletes the TPulseIsland objects, but g_event doesn't
00259   // own the pulses, they would be deleted later. A solution is to
00260   // be sure that TGlobalData isn't called in alcapana, or ensure
00261   // that g_event owns the pulse islands at that level.
00262   StringPulseIslandMap::iterator mapIter;
00263   StringPulseIslandMap::iterator mapEnd = data->fPulseIslandToChannelMap.end();
00264   for(mapIter = data->fPulseIslandToChannelMap.begin(); mapIter != mapEnd; mapIter++) {
00265     // The iterator is pointing to a pair<string, vector<TPulseIsland*> >
00266     std::vector<TPulseIsland*>& pulse_vector= mapIter->second;
00267     for(size_t i=0; i<pulse_vector.size(); i++){
00268       delete pulse_vector[i];
00269       pulse_vector[i] = NULL;
00270     }
00271     pulse_vector.clear();
00272   }
00273 
00274 
00275   for(StringAnalPulseMap::iterator mapIter=gAnalysedPulseMap.begin();
00276      mapIter != gAnalysedPulseMap.end(); mapIter++) {
00277 
00278     // The iterator is pointing to a pair<string, vector<TPulseIsland*> >
00279     AnalysedPulseList& pulse_vector= mapIter->second;
00280     for(size_t i=0; i<pulse_vector.size(); i++){
00281       delete pulse_vector[i];
00282       pulse_vector[i] = NULL;
00283     }
00284     pulse_vector.clear();
00285   }
00286   gAnalysedPulseMap.clear();
00287 
00288   for(StringDetPulseMap::iterator mapIter = gDetectorPulseMap.begin(); mapIter != gDetectorPulseMap.end(); mapIter++) {
00289     // The iterator is pointing to a pair<string, vector<TPulseIsland*> >
00290     std::vector<TDetectorPulse*>& pulse_vector= mapIter->second;
00291     for(size_t i=0; i<pulse_vector.size(); i++){
00292       delete pulse_vector[i];
00293       pulse_vector[i] = NULL;
00294     }
00295     pulse_vector.clear();
00296   }
00297   gDetectorPulseMap.clear();
00298 }

00300 TTree* GetTree(TFile* inFile, const char* t_name)
00301 {
00302    TTree* InfoTree = (TTree *)inFile->Get(t_name);
00303    if(!InfoTree) {
00304       printf("Unable to find TTree '%s' in %s.\n",t_name,inFile->GetName());
00305       return NULL;
00306    }
00307    //InfoTree->Print();
00308 
00309    return InfoTree;
00310 }
00311 
00312 TSetupData* TSetupData::Instance()
00313 {
00314   static TSetupData *s_data=NULL;
00315 
00316   // if s_data is already setup then we can just return it immediately
00317   if(s_data) return s_data;
00318 
00319   // Check we have a valid tree for the setup data
00320   TTree* setupTree= GetTree(gInFile, "SetupTree");
00321   if(!setupTree) return NULL;
00322 
00323   // Hook up the branch in the file to s_data and load in the data
00324   setupTree->SetBranchAddress("Setup",&s_data);
00325   if(!s_data) {
00326      printf("Unable to find TSetupData branch 'Setup' in the file");
00327      return NULL;
00328   }
00329   setupTree->GetEntry(0);
00330 
00331   return s_data;
00332 }
00333 
00334 void PrintSetupData(TSetupData* s_data){
00335      if(!s_data) return;
00336   // print things out
00337   std::map<std::string, std::string>::iterator it_info;
00338   printf("### TSetupData ###\n");
00339   printf("Bank  Detector Name  Clock Tick (ns)  Pedestal (ADC)  Trigger Polarity  Time Shift (ns)  No. of Bits\n");
00340   printf("----  -------------  ---------------  --------------  ----------------  ---------------  -----------\n");
00341   for (it_info=s_data->fBankToDetectorMap.begin();it_info!=s_data->fBankToDetectorMap.end();++it_info){
00342                  std::string bankname = it_info->first;
00343                  std::string detname = s_data->GetDetectorName(bankname);
00344                  float clockTick = s_data->GetClockTick(bankname);
00345                  int pedestal = s_data->GetPedestal(bankname);
00346                  int trig_pol = s_data->GetTriggerPolarity(bankname);
00347                  double time_shift = s_data->GetTimeShift(bankname);
00348                  int n_bits = s_data->GetNBits(bankname);
00349                  printf("%s  %s\t\t%f\t%d\t\t%d\t\t%f\t\t%d\n",bankname.c_str(), detname.c_str(), clockTick, pedestal, trig_pol, time_shift,n_bits);
00350   }
00351 }

00353 Int_t PrepareAnalysedPulseMap(TFile* fileOut){
00354         // TAnalysedMapWrapper
00355    gAnalysedPulseMapWrapper = new TAnalysedPulseMapWrapper(gAnalysedPulseMap);
00356 
00357    int split = 1;
00358    int bufsize = 64000;
00359    Int_t branchstyle = 1;
00360 
00361    if (split < 0) {branchstyle = 0; split = -1-split;}
00362    TTree::SetBranchStyle(branchstyle);
00363 
00364    gAnalysedPulseTree = new TTree("AnalysedPulseTree", "AnalysedPulseTree");
00365    gAnalysedPulseTree->SetAutoSave(100000000);
00366    gAnalysedPulseTree->SetMaxVirtualSize(100000000);
00367    gAnalysedPulseBranch = gAnalysedPulseTree->Branch("AnalysedPulseMapWrapper", 
00368                                                      "TAnalysedPulseMapWrapper", &gAnalysedPulseMapWrapper, bufsize, split);
00369    gAnalysedPulseBranch->SetAutoDelete(kFALSE);
00370    return 0;
00371 }

00373 Int_t PrepareSingletonObjects(const ARGUMENTS&){
00374    // Set up the modules navigator
00375    if(!modules::navigator::Instance()) return 1;
00376 
00377    // Make sure the instance of TSetupData get's loaded 
00378    // (though in practice we can do this lazily)
00379    //TSetupData* s_data = TSetupData::Instance();
00380    if(!TSetupData::Instance()) return 2;
00381 
00382    return 0;
00383 }
